踏.definition: to tread; to stamp; to step on; to press a pedal; to investigate on the spot

踏上.definition: to set foot on; to step on or into

踏勘.definition: to go and inspect (a site); to do an on-site survey

踏墊.definition: floor mat; bathroom mat; car mat; doormat

踏實.definition: firmly-based; steady; steadfast; to have peace of mind; free from anxiety; Taiwan pr. [ta4 shi2]

踏春.definition: to go for a hike in spring

踏月.definition: to go for a walk in the moonlight

踏板.definition: pedal (in a car, on a piano etc); treadle; footstool; footrest; footboard

踏歌.definition: to sing and dance; general term for a round dance

踏步.definition: stride; to step (on the spot); to mark time; at a standstill

踏步不前.definition: to be at a standstill; to mark time

踏破鐵鞋.definition: lit. to wear out one's iron shoes (idiom); fig. to search high and low

踏破鐵鞋無覓處，得來全不費工夫.pinyin: ta4 po4 tie3 xie2 wu2 mi4 chu4 , de2 lai2 quan2 bu4 fei4 gong1 fu5
踏破鐵鞋無覓處，得來全不費工夫.definition: to travel far and wide looking for sth, only to find it easily

踏破門檻.definition: to wear out the doorstep (idiom); to crowd at sb's door

踏空.definition: to miss one's step; (of an investor) to fail to invest before the price rises

踏足.definition: to set foot on (a foreign land etc); to tread; (fig.) to enter (a new sphere)

踏進.definition: to set foot in; to tread (in or on); to walk into

踏雪.definition: to go for a walk in the snow

踏雪尋梅.definition: to walk in the snow to view the flowering plum

踏青.definition: lit. tread the green; go for a walk in the spring (when the grass has turned green); spring hike season around Qingming festival 清明, 4th-6th April

踏青賞春.definition: to enjoy a beautiful spring walk (idiom)

踏青賞花.definition: to enjoy the flowers on a spring outing (idiom)
